title: White Heavy Check Mark

adjectives: Being satisfactory or in satisfactory condition
verbs: To be in accord in opinion, statement, or action; to be in unison or concord; to be united or consistent.
To harmonize in opinion, statement, or action; to be in unison or concord; to be or become united or consistent; to concur.
Be in accord; be in agreement
To unite or agree (in action or opinion); to have a common opinion; to coincide; to correspond.
nouns: A check mark, checkmark or tick is a mark used to indicate the concept "yes" applies to me").
A mark () made to indicate agreement, correctness or acknowledgement
A mark (?) made to indicate agreement, correctness or acknowledgement; checkmark
A mark like a v or sometimes x used as an indicator.
A mark (especially a checkmark: ) used as an indicator, equivalent to a tick (UK).
A mark (often one of a series) made to show that an operation or task has been completed.
A mark made to indicate agreement, correctness or acknowledgement.
A mark () made to indicate agreement, correctness or acknowledgement.
A mark indicating that something has been noted or completed etc.

description:
A check mark that displays with a white outlined appearance. Shows on most platforms with a bright green rounded rectangle or circle surrounding it.

Android previously displayed this as an outlined blue check mark / blue tick.

This emoji is not supported in Twitter / X names, possibly in an attempt to minimize confusion with a verified checkmark.
apple_vendor_description: The check mark button emoji on Apple devices is a vibrant, almost tactile symbol of completion and confirmation.  Rendered with a bold green hue and a glossy, raised appearance, it features distinct, soft rounded edges and a subtle shadow that gives it significant depth.  The crisp, clear check mark within the button offers a satisfying visual cue, commonly used to signify tasks done, agreements made, or successful actions.
